evals.expected_output: Config file missing detection -> interactive setup prompt OR change analysis -> commit message generation -> user confirmation -> safe commit execution
expectations: The skill checks for .claude/git-workflow.local.md config file existence
If no config exists, the skill initiates interactive setup before committing
The skill runs git diff --staged, git diff, and git status to analyze changes
If no changes exist, the skill informs the user and stops
The skill reads recent commit messages for style reference
The skill generates a commit message following the configured convention
The skill presents the commit message to the user for approval before executing
The skill stages files using explicit file paths, never git add -A or git add .
The skill uses HEREDOC for the commit message formatting
The skill runs git status after commit to verify success

evals.expected_output: Pre-flight check for existing PR -> push with -u -> PR creation with generated title and body -> display PR URL
expectations: The skill checks for .claude/git-workflow.local.md config file existence
The skill checks for existing PR on the current branch using gh pr list --head
If a PR already exists, the skill displays the existing PR URL
The skill pushes the current branch with -u flag if no upstream is configured
The skill collects commits since divergence from base branch using git log
The skill runs git diff against base branch to understand full scope of changes
The skill generates a PR title of 70 characters or fewer
The skill generates a PR body with Summary and Test plan sections
The skill creates the PR using gh pr create targeting the configured base branch
The skill displays the PR URL after creation

evals.expected_output: Fetch and prune -> identify gone branches -> list and confirm -> safe deletion
expectations: The skill checks for .claude/git-workflow.local.md config file existence
The skill runs git fetch --prune to update remote tracking state
The skill identifies local branches whose upstream is marked as [gone]
If no gone branches exist, the skill informs the user and stops
The skill lists gone branches and asks the user for confirmation before deletion
The skill uses git branch -d (safe delete) not git branch -D
The skill never force-deletes branches without explicit user request
